glsa.title: Gaim: New vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Gaim contains several security issues that might allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code or commands.

background.p: Gaim is a multi-protocol instant messaging client for Linux which supports many instant messaging protocols.

description.p: Gaim fails to do proper bounds checking when:

ul.li: Handling MSN messages (partially fixed with GLSA 200408-12).
Allocating memory for webpages with fake content-length header.

description.p: Furthermore Gaim fails to escape filenames when using drag and drop installation of smiley themes.

impact.p: These vulnerabilities could allow an attacker to crash Gaim or execute arbitrary code or commands with the permissions of the user running Gaim.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time. All users are encouraged to upgrade to the latest available version of Gaim.
